item.title: Report E-2025010051
item.description:
Report E-2025010051

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-09
  • City: FIFE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:40 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UTA) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 3 gallons of Klean Strip Acetone (hazardous - UN1090) was released on the trailer; and 9 cans of Fuel -Denatured Alcohol (hazardous - UN1987) was refused by the Consignee. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and 4 damaged cans of UN1090 - Acetone will be placed into a 20-gallon metal drum, while the 9 cans of UN1987 - Denatured Alcohol will be placed into a 35-gallon metal drum, and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry.

item.title: Report E-2025010043
item.description:
Report E-2025010043

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: FIFE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 16:50 PM ET, UTA contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred in a trailer in Fife, WA. The spill consisted of 2-5 gallon metal pails due to a puncture in the pails, cause unknown. The spill was approximately 12 ounces and was contained to the sides of the containers and the shrink-wrap. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they placed the pails and the shrink wrap in (1)35-gallon metal drum with plastic lining.
